p: Table 1 shows that the prevalence of diabetes was slightly higher among those 50 years and older (13.1%). The prevalence of high blood pressure was higher among teachers of other race groups (35.2%), those 50 years and older (33.3%) and among teachers in senior positions (26.4%). The prevalence of stomach ulcers were slightly higher among teachers 18â€“24 years age (22.9%), and those in urban informal schools (21.1%). The prevalence of self-reported Lung / breathing problems, cancers and heart diseases was low.
